result.execSummary:
The defendant Harry Ramon Santiago Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To pay the costs of the action. (costs have been paid in full)
Consecutive to any other sentence. Huber release and good time granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harry Ramon Santiago Diaz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant was fingerprinted 5/02/17.
for DNA Sample

Defendant Harry Ramon Santiago Diaz in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sarah Chwaszczewski sworn, interprets for defendant.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Sarah Chwaszczewski will be here to interpret 4/24/17.
Status conference on April 24, 2017 at 08:45 am.
from ADA Korb requesting 5/30/17 status be moved up as soon as possible. Email correspondence between ADA Korb and Dep. Werner.

Attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions Atty Fagundes on where matter is at. Atty Fagundes indicates defendant is serving a sentence in Brown County and Brown County Jail would not extend his time to attend court when he was done with work. Court reschedules matter until after defendant is released from the Brown County Jail. Atty Fagundes will advise defendant of next court date. Atty Fagunes to let court know if matter will be resolved on 5/30/17 so an interpreter can be in court in person.  Status conference scheduled for May 30, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Interpreter canceled based on call from Atty Fagundes office indicating Brown County Jail won't let defendant appear in court when he's done with work. He must immediately return to the Brown County Jail.
John Vaughn will be here to interpret Monday, 12/05/16 at 4:00 pm.

of Appointment

from Brown County Jail
Court quashes warrant.
Fingerprints and photographs by Law Enforcement by next court date.

Defendant Harry Ramon Santiago Diaz appears by video from Brown County Jail along with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes who appears in person.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Susan Rascon interprets for defendant, sworn.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Atty Fagundes asks Court to quash warrant. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State has no objection to court quashing the warrant, defendant will then have huber privileges and will be able to make court appearances in person. Atty Fagundes requests a status in 60 days. Atty Fagundes to let the court know if matter is resolved at next hearing so clerk can make arrangements for interpreter to be in court in person. Bond set. Clerk will fax bond to Brown County Jail for defendant to sign.  Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Hearing on September 22, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Video conference set up with Brown County Jail for 9/22/16 at 2:45 pm.
from Atty Fagundes requesting Court schedule a hearing to address warrant as soon as possible. Court sets. hearing.
from defendant requesting to be transported to Door County to take care of the warrant. Court advises defendant to contact an atty. DTE
from defendant requesting to be transported to Door County to take care of the warrant. Per Court, contact an atty. DTE
